comment: Lemma for well-founded recursion. From here through ~ wfrlem16 , we aim to prove that ` dom F = A ` . We do this by supposing that there is an element ` z ` of ` A ` that is not in ` dom F ` . We then define ` C ` by extending ` dom F ` with the appropriate value at ` z ` . We then show that ` z ` cannot be an ` R ` minimal element of ` ( A \ dom F ) ` , meaning that ` ( A \ dom F ) ` must be empty, so ` dom F = A ` . Here, we show that ` C ` is a function extending the domain of ` F ` by one. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 21-Apr-2011.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 26-Jun-2015.)
